section: The exclusive purpose of the Venture (the "Purpose") will be IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service. This purpose may be changed at any time at the discretion of BorrowMoney.com, inc.
explanation: The initial statement defines the Venture's purpose as IT development and related services for the medical field. However, the subsequent clause grants BorrowMoney.com, Inc. the sole discretion to change this purpose at any time. This creates a contradiction because while the Venture is initially established for a specific purpose with the agreement of all members, one member can unilaterally alter this purpose, potentially against the interests or wishes of the other member. This undermines the collaborative nature of a joint venture.

section: Any vote required by the Members will be determined such that each Member receives one vote, however, BorrowMoney.com, inc.'s vote will carry twice the weight of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's vote.
explanation: The initial part of the sentence states that each member receives one vote. However, the clause that follows immediately contradicts this by stating that BorrowMoney.com, Inc.'s vote carries twice the weight of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's vote. The votes are not equally weighted, therefore, the sentence creates an internal contradiction by stating one thing then immediately stating another that directly opposes the first statement.

section: This Agreement may be amended with the consent of BorrowMoney.com, inc., notwithstanding any objection from JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go.
explanation: This section presents a structural flaw in the agreement. Joint venture agreements are generally intended to be partnerships where all parties have a say in the business decisions. This clause gives BorrowMoney.com, Inc. the sole power to amend the agreement, regardless of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's objections. This undermines the basic principle of mutual consent and collaboration that a joint venture agreement should embody. This makes the agreement more akin to a dictatorial business structure than a collaboration.
